alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Charles; St. Louis; St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 12:28AM CDT until July 02 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... St. Louis City in east central Missouri... Central St. Charles County in east central Missouri... Northeastern Jefferson County in east central Missouri... St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1228 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Maryland Heights to Barnhart, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... St. Louis, St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Overland, Clayton, Cahokia, and Jennings. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 269 and 277. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 227 and 231. This also includes Scott Joplin Historic Site, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Mastodon Historic Site, and First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson; St. Charles; St. Louis; St. Louis City
